title: Health Service Challenge in UK and China

content.question: Which of the following accurately explains a common challenge for health services in both the United Kingdom and China?

choices.label: Both countries have an aging population, so more governmental resources will be needed to deal with health issues.
The quality of health care is radically different in rural and urban areas in both countries.
The major political parties in both countries have called for the end of state-run health care systems.
Both countries have too many young people and have implemented policies aimed at lowering the population growth rates.

content.answer: Both countries have an aging population, so more governmental resources will be needed to deal with health issues.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with similar political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
